alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 15 at 8:32PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Henry IL, Whiteside and Rock Island Counties. ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River at Moline affecting Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...From Friday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding of unprotected agricultural land occurs. Water also affects Lundeens Landing Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning.
